member.name: F:Cortex.Net.DerivationState.NotTracking
member.summary: Before being run or (outside batch and not being observed). at this point derivation is not holding any data about dependency tree

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.DerivationState.UpToDate
member.summary: No shallow dependency changed since last computation. We won't recalculate the derivation. This is what makes Cortex.Net fast.

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.DerivationState.PossiblyStale
member.summary:
Some deep dependency has changed, but we don't know if a shallow dependency has changed. This will require to check first if this derivation is UpToDate or PossiblyStale. Currently only ComputedValue will propagate PossiblyStale.
Having this state is the second big optimization: We don't have to recompute on every dependency change, but only when it's necessary.

member.name: F:Cortex.Net.DerivationState.Stale
member.summary: A shallow dependency has changed since last computation and the derivation will need to recompute when it's necessary next.
